snippet: Twelve agents sent to Colombia before President Obama’s arrival for the Summit of Americas were relieved of duty amid accusations of misconduct that are said to have involved prostitution.
abstract: Twelve Secret Service agents sent to Cartagena, Colombia, before Pres Obama’s arrival for the Summit of the Americas are relieved of duty, amid accusations of misconduct that are said to have involved prostitution.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and MATT FLEGENHEIMER
byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes reported from Cartagena, and Matt Flegenheimer from New York.

lead_paragraph: Twelve agents sent to Colombia before President Obama’s arrival for the Summit of Americas were relieved of duty amid accusations of misconduct that are said to have involved prostitution.

headline.seo: Secret Service Agents in Colombia Accused of Misconduct
headline.main: Secret Service Agents Accused of Misconduct
headline.print_headline: Secret Service Agents Accused of Misconduct
